channel.title: Object facing when cooking or wcing and ect[pi]

item.title: Object facing when cooking or wcing and ect[pi]
item.dc:creator: @I_Smoke_Kush I Smoke Kush
item.description:
@I_Smoke_Kush wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:545772”][quote author=Dan0194 link=topic=664656.msg4443151#msg4443151 date=1407553479]
Horrible way of doing it you should be doing this for each object. Make an event and once your player reaches the coordinates handle the object action. You should be doing this with almost everything objects,mobs, ground items.
[/quote]
This is already coded in PI. Or it should be. It’s poorly done though.

It’s handled in process() of Client.java normally. And that should be changed (there’s a guide out there to change it somewhere).
It should go to ClickObject.java and then if it’s good distance it’ll run in the actionhandler.
That’s what I know from my knowledge. mine is a bit different (doesn’t use process()).[/quote]

Sorry for the confusion, Your code works a bit it starts facing the direction and comes closer doesn’t walk next to the stove, also doesn’t stop cooking when walking away, I tried writing some to make it work.

[code]if(c.isCooking == false)) {
c.stopCooking
}

[/code]

trying to make something like that

Read full topic
item.source: Object facing when cooking or wcing and ect[pi]

item.title: Object facing when cooking or wcing and ect[pi]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Dan0194:

Horrible way of doing it you should be doing this for each object. Make an event and once your player reaches the coordinates handle the object action. You should be doing this with almost everything objects,mobs, ground items.

This is already coded in PI. Or it should be. It’s poorly done though.

It’s handled in process() of Client.java normally. And that should be changed (there’s a guide out there to change it somewhere).
It should go to ClickObject.java and then if it’s good distance it’ll run in the actionhandler.
That’s what I know from my knowledge. mine is a bit different (doesn’t use process()).

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“I Smoke Kush, post:3, topic:545772”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664656.msg4443119#msg4443119 date=1407541424]
c.turnPlayerTo(x, y);
[/quote]

Thanks, turning works now.

Why would my code that I am trying to use below not work

Was it erroring or just not working?
If errors, post them.
walkPlayerTo is supposed to make a player walk to the coords provided.

item.title: Object facing when cooking or wcing and ect[pi]
item.dc:creator: @I_Smoke_Kush I Smoke Kush
item.description:
@I_Smoke_Kush wrote:

case 2728:

		if (c.objectX == 2728) {
			if (c.absX < c.objectX) {
				c.getPA().walkTo(1,0);
			} else {
				c.getPA().walkTo(-1,0);
			}

Trying to make something like this for my cooking range, pisses me off when players cook from like -4 squares away lol. I got errors when writing this code, any suggestions?

Read full topic
